showGroupedColumn.helpDescription: Show grouped column also as a column, not just as group header
showGroupedColumn.description: Show grouped column also as a column, not just as group header

moveDown.helpDescription: Change the group order of the columns. Move column one position down in the group sequence
moveDown.description: Change the group order of the columns. Move column one position down in the group sequence

moveUp.helpDescription: Change the group order of the columns. Move column one position up in the group sequence
moveUp.description: Change the group order of the columns. Move column one position up in the group sequence

hideGroupedColumn.helpDescription: Show grouped column only as group header
hideGroupedColumn.description: Show grouped column only as group header

MultiToggle.helpDescription: Select multiple rows at a time (toggle behavior).
MultiToggle.description: Select multiple rows at a time (toggle behavior).

Multi.helpDescription: Select multiple rows at a time.
Multi.description: Select multiple rows at a time.

Single.helpDescription: Select one row at a time.
Single.description: Select one row at a time.

Interactive.helpDescription: After rendering the table has as many rows as defined in visibleRowCount property. The user is able to change the visible rows by moving a grip with the mouse. The visibleRowCount property is changed accordingly.
Interactive.description: After rendering the table has as many rows as defined in visibleRowCount property. The user is able to change the visible rows by moving a grip with the mouse. The visibleRowCount property is changed accordingly.

Auto.helpDescription: The table automatically fills the height of the surrounding container. The visibleRowCount property is automatically changed accordingly. All rows need the same height, otherwise the auto mode doesn't always work as expected.
Auto.description: The table automatically fills the height of the surrounding container. The visibleRowCount property is automatically changed accordingly. All rows need the same height, otherwise the auto mode doesn't always work as expected.

Fixed.helpDescription: The table always has as many rows as defined in the visibleRowCount property.
Fixed.description: The table always has as many rows as defined in the visibleRowCount property.

RowOnly.helpDescription: Rows can only be selected on the row (and the selector is hidden).
RowOnly.description: Rows can only be selected on the row (and the selector is hidden).

Row.helpDescription: Rows can be selected on the complete row.
Row.description: Rows can be selected on the complete row.

RowSelector.helpDescription: Rows can only be selected on the row selector.
RowSelector.description: Rows can only be selected on the row selector.

sap.ui.table.Column.helpDescription: The column allows to define column specific properties that will be applied when rendering the table.
sap.ui.table.Column.description: The column allows to define column specific properties that will be applied when rendering the table.

template.helpDescription: Template (cell renderer) of this column. A template is decoupled from the column which means after changing the templates' properties or aggregations an explicit invalidation of the column or table is required. The default is: sap.ui.commons.TextView.
template.description: Template (cell renderer) of this column. A template is decoupled from the column which means after changing the templates' properties or aggregations an explicit invalidation of the column or table is required. The default is: sap.ui.commons.TextView.

multiLabels.helpDescription: Labels (header renderer) of the column which are displayed in the column header. Define a control for each header row in the table. Use this aggregation, if you want to use multiple headers per column.
multiLabels.description: Labels (header renderer) of the column which are displayed in the column header. Define a control for each header row in the table. Use this aggregation, if you want to use multiple headers per column.

menu.helpDescription: The menu used by the column. By default the {@link sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu} is used.
menu.description: The menu used by the column. By default the {@link sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu} is used.

label.helpDescription: Label (header renderer) of the column which is displayed in the column header. Define a control for each header row in the table. This aggregation is for the standard behaviour, if you only want to display one single row header.
label.description: Label (header renderer) of the column which is displayed in the column header. Define a control for each header row in the table. This aggregation is for the standard behaviour, if you only want to display one single row header.

filterProperty.helpDescription: Specifies the binding property on which the column will filter.
filterProperty.description: Specifies the binding property on which the column will filter.

autoResizable.helpDescription: Enables auto-resizing of the column on doubleclicking the resizer. Currently only implemented to work with the following controls: sap.m.Text, sap.m.Label, sap.m.Link , sap.m.Input, sap.ui.commons.TextView, sap.ui.commons.Label, sap.ui.commons.Link and sap.ui.commons.TextField, sap.ui.commons.Checkbox, sap.m.Checkbox
autoResizable.description: Enables auto-resizing of the column on doubleclicking the resizer. Currently only implemented to work with the following controls: sap.m.Text, sap.m.Label, sap.m.Link , sap.m.Input, sap.ui.commons.TextView, sap.ui.commons.Label, sap.ui.commons.Link and sap.ui.commons.TextField, sap.ui.commons.Checkbox, sap.m.Checkbox

filtered.helpDescription: flag, if the column is filtered or not (displays the filter indicator, does not trigger the filter method!)
filtered.description: flag, if the column is filtered or not (displays the filter indicator, does not trigger the filter method!)

sortProperty.helpDescription: Specifies the binding property on which the column will sort.
sortProperty.description: Specifies the binding property on which the column will sort.

defaultFilterOperator.helpDescription:
If this property is set the default filter operator of the column is overwritten.
By default "Contains" is used for string and "EQ" for other types. A valid sap.ui.model.FilterOperator needs to be passed.
defaultFilterOperator.description:
If this property is set the default filter operator of the column is overwritten.
By default "Contains" is used for string and "EQ" for other types. A valid sap.ui.model.FilterOperator needs to be passed.

hAlign.helpDescription: Horizontal alignment of the column content. Controls with a text align do not inherit the horizontal alignment. You have to set the text align directly on the template.
hAlign.description: Horizontal alignment of the column content. Controls with a text align do not inherit the horizontal alignment. You have to set the text align directly on the template.

sorted.helpDescription: flag, if the column is sorted or not (displays the sorting indicator, does not trigger the sort method!)
sorted.description: flag, if the column is sorted or not (displays the sorting indicator, does not trigger the sort method!)

flexible.helpDescription: Is the width of the column flexible (grows on resize)?
flexible.description: Is the width of the column flexible (grows on resize)?

showFilterMenuEntry.helpDescription: Define if the filter menu entry is displayed
showFilterMenuEntry.description: Define if the filter menu entry is displayed

filterValue.helpDescription: Specifies the value of the filter as string (will be converted into the propert data type).
filterValue.description: Specifies the value of the filter as string (will be converted into the propert data type).

filterOperator.helpDescription: Filter operator to use when filtering this column.
filterOperator.description: Filter operator to use when filtering this column.

grouped.helpDescription: flag, if the column is grouped or not (hides the column!)
grouped.description: flag, if the column is grouped or not (hides the column!)

name.helpDescription: The name of the column which is used in the column visibility menu item as text. If not set as fallback the column menu tries to get the text from the nested Label.
name.description: The name of the column which is used in the column visibility menu item as text. If not set as fallback the column menu tries to get the text from the nested Label.

resizable.helpDescription: Is the column resizable or not?
resizable.description: Is the column resizable or not?

showSortMenuEntry.helpDescription: Define if the sort menu entries are displayed
showSortMenuEntry.description: Define if the sort menu entries are displayed

filterType.helpDescription: Type of Filter. This is used to transform the search term to the specified type, to make sure that the right columns are displayed. This should be the same as defined in binding for this column. As alternative you can pass a function which does the conversion. The function receives the entered filter value as parameter and returns the proper value for the filter expression. Another option is to pass the classname of the type, e.g.: sap.ui.model.type.Date or an expression similar to the binding syntax, e.g.: "\{type: 'sap.ui.model.type.Date', formatOptions: \{UTC: true\}, constraints: {} \}". Here the escaping is mandatory to avoid handling by the binding parser. By default the filter type is sap.ui.model.type.String.
filterType.description: Type of Filter. This is used to transform the search term to the specified type, to make sure that the right columns are displayed. This should be the same as defined in binding for this column. As alternative you can pass a function which does the conversion. The function receives the entered filter value as parameter and returns the proper value for the filter expression. Another option is to pass the classname of the type, e.g.: sap.ui.model.type.Date or an expression similar to the binding syntax, e.g.: "\{type: 'sap.ui.model.type.Date', formatOptions: \{UTC: true\}, constraints: {} \}". Here the escaping is mandatory to avoid handling by the binding parser. By default the filter type is sap.ui.model.type.String.

headerSpan.helpDescription: If this property is set a span is applied for the header. When moving columns all columns which are part of the header will be moved. This can be either an integer or an array of integers (if you use the multi header feature of the table). If you only specify an integer this span is applied for all header rows, with multiple integers you can specify a seperate span for each header row.
headerSpan.description: If this property is set a span is applied for the header. When moving columns all columns which are part of the header will be moved. This can be either an integer or an array of integers (if you use the multi header feature of the table). If you only specify an integer this span is applied for all header rows, with multiple integers you can specify a seperate span for each header row.

sap.ui.table.AnalyticalTable.description: Table which handles analytical OData backends

extension.helpDescription: Extension section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)
extension.description: Extension section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)

footer.helpDescription: Control or text of footer section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)
footer.description: Control or text of footer section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)

title.helpDescription: Control or text of title section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)
title.description: Control or text of title section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)

toolbar.helpDescription: Toolbar of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)
toolbar.description: Toolbar of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)

noData.helpDescription: The value for the noData aggregation can be either a string value or a control instance. The control is shown, in case there is no data for the Table available. In case of a string value this will simply replace the no data text.
noData.description: The value for the noData aggregation can be either a string value or a control instance. The control is shown, in case there is no data for the Table available. In case of a string value this will simply replace the no data text.

visibleRowCountMode.helpDescription: This defines how the table handles the visible rows in the table. The default behavior is, that a fixed row count is defined. If you change it to auto the visibleRowCount property is changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its maximum row count to the space it is allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) and its minimum row count to the value of the property minAutoRowCount (default value : 5) In manual mode the user can change the visibleRowCount interactively.
visibleRowCountMode.description: This defines how the table handles the visible rows in the table. The default behavior is, that a fixed row count is defined. If you change it to auto the visibleRowCount property is changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its maximum row count to the space it is allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) and its minimum row count to the value of the property minAutoRowCount (default value : 5) In manual mode the user can change the visibleRowCount interactively.

autoExpandMode.helpDescription:
The kind of auto expansion algorithm, e.g. optimised filter conditions, per level requests, ...
sap.ui.table.TreeAutoExpandMode
autoExpandMode.description:
The kind of auto expansion algorithm, e.g. optimised filter conditions, per level requests, ...
sap.ui.table.TreeAutoExpandMode

sumOnTop.helpDescription: Specifies if the total values should be displayed in the group headers or on bottom of the row. Does not affact the total sum.
sumOnTop.description: Specifies if the total values should be displayed in the group headers or on bottom of the row. Does not affact the total sum.

enableGrouping.helpDescription: Flag to enable or disable column grouping. (experimental!)
enableGrouping.description: Flag to enable or disable column grouping. (experimental!)

enableBusyIndicator.helpDescription: Set this parameter to true to make the table handle the busy indicator by its own. The table will switch to busy as soon as it scrolls into an unpaged area.
enableBusyIndicator.description: Set this parameter to true to make the table handle the busy indicator by its own. The table will switch to busy as soon as it scrolls into an unpaged area.

columnVisibilityMenuSorter.helpDescription: Functions which is used to sort the column visibility menu entries e.g.: function(ColumnA, ColumnB) { return 0 = equals, <0 lower, >0 greater }; Other values than functions will be ignored.
columnVisibilityMenuSorter.description: Functions which is used to sort the column visibility menu entries e.g.: function(ColumnA, ColumnB) { return 0 = equals, <0 lower, >0 greater }; Other values than functions will be ignored.

showOverlay.helpDescription: Setting this property to true will show an overlay on top of the Table content and users cannot click anymore on the Table content.
showOverlay.description: Setting this property to true will show an overlay on top of the Table content and users cannot click anymore on the Table content.

enableSelectAll.helpDescription: Specifies if a select all button should be displayed in the top left corner.
enableSelectAll.description: Specifies if a select all button should be displayed in the top left corner.

columnHeaderVisible.helpDescription: Flag whether the column header is visible or not.
columnHeaderVisible.description: Flag whether the column header is visible or not.

enableCellFilter.helpDescription: Flag whether to enable or disable the context menu on cells to trigger a filtering with the cell value.
enableCellFilter.description: Flag whether to enable or disable the context menu on cells to trigger a filtering with the cell value.

columnHeaderHeight.helpDescription: Height of the column header of the Table in pixel.
columnHeaderHeight.description: Height of the column header of the Table in pixel.

dirty.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.21.2 Please use setShowOverlay instead.
If dirty the content of the Table will be overlayed.
dirty.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.21.2 Please use setShowOverlay instead.
If dirty the content of the Table will be overlayed.

enableColumnFreeze.helpDescription: Flag whether to show or hide the column menu item to freeze or unfreeze a column.
enableColumnFreeze.description: Flag whether to show or hide the column menu item to freeze or unfreeze a column.

selectedIndex.helpDescription: Zero-based index of selected item. Index value for no selection is -1. When multi-selection is enabled and multiple items are selected, the method returns the lead selected item. Sets the zero-based index of the currently selected item. This method removes any previous selections. When the given index is invalid, the call is ignored.
selectedIndex.description: Zero-based index of selected item. Index value for no selection is -1. When multi-selection is enabled and multiple items are selected, the method returns the lead selected item. Sets the zero-based index of the currently selected item. This method removes any previous selections. When the given index is invalid, the call is ignored.

noDataText.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22.1 The aggregation noData also supports string values now. Use noData instead.
This text is shown, in case there is no data available to be displayed in the Table and no custom noData control is set.
noDataText.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.22.1 The aggregation noData also supports string values now. Use noData instead.
This text is shown, in case there is no data available to be displayed in the Table and no custom noData control is set.

minAutoRowCount.helpDescription: This property is used to set the minimum count of visible rows when the property visibleRowCountMode is set to Auto. For any other visibleRowCountMode, it is ignored.
minAutoRowCount.description: This property is used to set the minimum count of visible rows when the property visibleRowCountMode is set to Auto. For any other visibleRowCountMode, it is ignored.

showNoData.helpDescription: Flag whether to show the no data overlay or not once the table is empty.
showNoData.description: Flag whether to show the no data overlay or not once the table is empty.

collapseRecursive.helpDescription: Setting collapseRecursive to true means, that when collapsing a node all subsequent child nodes will also be collapsed.
collapseRecursive.description: Setting collapseRecursive to true means, that when collapsing a node all subsequent child nodes will also be collapsed.

visibleRowCount.helpDescription: Count of visible rows (will overwrite the height property).
visibleRowCount.description: Count of visible rows (will overwrite the height property).

fixedBottomRowCount.helpDescription: Number of rows that are fix on the bottom. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll. (experimental!)
fixedBottomRowCount.description: Number of rows that are fix on the bottom. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll. (experimental!)

navigationMode.helpDescription: Flag whether to use the scroll mode or paging mode. If the Paginator mode is used it will require the sap.ui.commons library!
navigationMode.description: Flag whether to use the scroll mode or paging mode. If the Paginator mode is used it will require the sap.ui.commons library!

allowColumnReordering.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.5.2 Use the property enableColumnReordering instead.
Flag to enable or disable column reordering
allowColumnReordering.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.5.2 Use the property enableColumnReordering instead.
Flag to enable or disable column reordering

rowHeight.helpDescription: Height of a row of the Table in pixel.
rowHeight.description: Height of a row of the Table in pixel.

editable.helpDescription: Flag whether the controls of the Table are editable or not (currently this only controls the background color!)
editable.description: Flag whether the controls of the Table are editable or not (currently this only controls the background color!)

showColumnVisibilityMenu.helpDescription: Flag to show or hide the column visibility menu.
showColumnVisibilityMenu.description: Flag to show or hide the column visibility menu.

threshold.helpDescription: Threshold to fetch the next chunk of data. The minimal threshold can be the visible row count of the Table. If the value is 0 then the thresholding is disabled.
threshold.description: Threshold to fetch the next chunk of data. The minimal threshold can be the visible row count of the Table. If the value is 0 then the thresholding is disabled.

enableColumnReordering.helpDescription: Flag to enable or disable column reordering
enableColumnReordering.description: Flag to enable or disable column reordering

numberOfExpandedLevels.helpDescription: Number of levels, which should be opened initially (on first load of data).
numberOfExpandedLevels.description: Number of levels, which should be opened initially (on first load of data).

enableCustomFilter.helpDescription: Set this parameter to true to implement your own filter behaviour. Instead of the filter input box a button will be rendered for which' press event (customFilter) you can register an event handler.
enableCustomFilter.description: Set this parameter to true to implement your own filter behaviour. Instead of the filter input box a button will be rendered for which' press event (customFilter) you can register an event handler.

fixedColumnCount.helpDescription: Number of columns that are fix on the left. When you use a horizontal scroll bar, only the columns which are not fixed, will scroll. Fixed columns need a defined width for the feature to work.
fixedColumnCount.description: Number of columns that are fix on the left. When you use a horizontal scroll bar, only the columns which are not fixed, will scroll. Fixed columns need a defined width for the feature to work.

fixedRowCount.helpDescription: Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll.
fixedRowCount.description: Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll.

sap.ui.table.DataTable.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.5.1 The DataTable has been replaced via the Table/TreeTable control.
The DataTable control provides a set of sophisticated and comfort functions for table design. For example, you can make settings for the number of visible rows and a number for the displayed rows in the case the user expands the table. The first visible row can be explicitly set. For the selection of columns and rows, a Multi, a Single, a None, and an All mode are available. Setting the Editable property to true lets the user make changes on the table cell entries.

rowSelect.helpDescription: fired when the row selection of the table has been changed
rowSelect.description: fired when the row selection of the table has been changed
rowSelect.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.table.DataTable.description: The DataTable control provides a set of sophisticated and comfort functions for table design. For example, you can make settings for the number of visible rows and a number for the displayed rows in the case the user expands the table. The first visible row can be explicitly set. For the selection of columns and rows, a Multi, a Single, a None, and an All mode are available. Setting the Editable property to true lets the user make changes on the table cell entries.

If you change it to auto the visibleRowCount property is changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its maximum row count to the space it is allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) and its minimum row count to the value of the property minAutoRowCount (default value : 5) In manual mode the user can change the visibleRowCount interactively.

noDataText.helpDescription:

rootLevel.helpDescription:
The root level is the level of the topmost tree nodes, which will be used as an entry point for OData services.
This property is only supported when the TreeTable uses an underlying odata services with hierarchy annotations.
This property is only supported with sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel
The hierarchy annotations may also be provided locally as a parameter for the ODataTreeBinding.
rootLevel.description:
The root level is the level of the topmost tree nodes, which will be used as an entry point for OData services.
This property is only supported when the TreeTable uses an underlying odata services with hierarchy annotations.
This property is only supported with sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel
The hierarchy annotations may also be provided locally as a parameter for the ODataTreeBinding.

enableCustomFilter.helpDescription: Set this parameter to true to implement your own filter behaviour. Instead of the filter input box a button will be rendered for which' press event (customFilter) you can register an event handler.
enableCustomFilter.description: Set this parameter to true to implement your own filter behaviour. Instead of the filter input box a button will be rendered for which' press event (customFilter) you can register an event handler.

useGroupMode.helpDescription:
If group mode is enable nodes with subitems are rendered as if they were group headers.
This can be used to do the grouping for an OData service on the backend and visualize this in a table.
This mode only makes sense if the tree has a depth of exacly 1 (group headers and entries)
useGroupMode.description:
If group mode is enable nodes with subitems are rendered as if they were group headers.
This can be used to do the grouping for an OData service on the backend and visualize this in a table.
This mode only makes sense if the tree has a depth of exacly 1 (group headers and entries)

fixedColumnCount.helpDescription: Number of columns that are fix on the left. When you use a horizontal scroll bar, only the columns which are not fixed, will scroll. Fixed columns need a defined width for the feature to work.
fixedColumnCount.description: Number of columns that are fix on the left. When you use a horizontal scroll bar, only the columns which are not fixed, will scroll. Fixed columns need a defined width for the feature to work.

fixedRowCount.helpDescription: Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll.
fixedRowCount.description: Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll.

sap.ui.table.AnalyticalColumnMenu.description: A column menu which is used by the analytical column

sap.ui.table.AnalyticalColumn.description: This column addes additional properties to the tabl ecolumn which are needed for the analytical binding and table

template.helpDescription: Template (cell renderer) of this column. A template is decoupled from the column which means after changing the templates' properties or aggregations an explicit invalidation of the column or table is required. The default is: sap.ui.commons.TextView.
template.description: Template (cell renderer) of this column. A template is decoupled from the column which means after changing the templates' properties or aggregations an explicit invalidation of the column or table is required. The default is: sap.ui.commons.TextView.

multiLabels.helpDescription: Labels (header renderer) of the column which are displayed in the column header. Define a control for each header row in the table. Use this aggregation, if you want to use multiple headers per column.
multiLabels.description: Labels (header renderer) of the column which are displayed in the column header. Define a control for each header row in the table. Use this aggregation, if you want to use multiple headers per column.

menu.helpDescription: The menu used by the column. By default the {@link sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu} is used.
menu.description: The menu used by the column. By default the {@link sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu} is used.

label.helpDescription: Label (header renderer) of the column which is displayed in the column header. Define a control for each header row in the table. This aggregation is for the standard behaviour, if you only want to display one single row header.
label.description: Label (header renderer) of the column which is displayed in the column header. Define a control for each header row in the table. This aggregation is for the standard behaviour, if you only want to display one single row header.

filterProperty.helpDescription: Specifies the binding property on which the column will filter.
filterProperty.description: Specifies the binding property on which the column will filter.

filtered.helpDescription: flag, if the column is filtered or not (displays the filter indicator, does not trigger the filter method!)
filtered.description: flag, if the column is filtered or not (displays the filter indicator, does not trigger the filter method!)

hAlign.helpDescription: Horizontal alignment of the column content. Controls with a text align do not inherit the horizontal alignment. You have to set the text align directly on the template.
hAlign.description: Horizontal alignment of the column content. Controls with a text align do not inherit the horizontal alignment. You have to set the text align directly on the template.

groupHeaderFormatter.helpDescription: If the column is grouped, this formatter is used to format the value in the group header
groupHeaderFormatter.description: If the column is grouped, this formatter is used to format the value in the group header

showFilterMenuEntry.helpDescription: Define if the filter menu entry is displayed
showFilterMenuEntry.description: Define if the filter menu entry is displayed

filterValue.helpDescription: Specifies the value of the filter as string (will be converted into the propert data type).
filterValue.description: Specifies the value of the filter as string (will be converted into the propert data type).

filterOperator.helpDescription: Filter operator to use when filtering this column.
filterOperator.description: Filter operator to use when filtering this column.

grouped.helpDescription: flag, if the column is grouped or not (hides the column!)
grouped.description: flag, if the column is grouped or not (hides the column!)

showIfGrouped.helpDescription: Specifies whether the column is displayed within the table even if it is grouped or not. A grouped column has the same value for every rows within the group.
showIfGrouped.description: Specifies whether the column is displayed within the table even if it is grouped or not. A grouped column has the same value for every rows within the group.

name.helpDescription: The name of the column which is used in the column visibility menu item as text. If not set as fallback the column menu tries to get the text from the nested Label.
name.description: The name of the column which is used in the column visibility menu item as text. If not set as fallback the column menu tries to get the text from the nested Label.

resizable.helpDescription: Is the column resizable or not?
resizable.description: Is the column resizable or not?

headerSpan.helpDescription: If this property is set a span is applied for the header. When moving columns all columns which are part of the header will be moved. This can be either an integer or an array of integers (if you use the multi header feature of the table). If you only specify an integer this span is applied for all header rows, with multiple integers you can specify a seperate span for each header row.
headerSpan.description: If this property is set a span is applied for the header. When moving columns all columns which are part of the header will be moved. This can be either an integer or an array of integers (if you use the multi header feature of the table). If you only specify an integer this span is applied for all header rows, with multiple integers you can specify a seperate span for each header row.

autoResizable.helpDescription: Enables auto-resizing of the column on doubleclicking the resizer. Currently only implemented to work with the following controls: sap.m.Text, sap.m.Label, sap.m.Link , sap.m.Input, sap.ui.commons.TextView, sap.ui.commons.Label, sap.ui.commons.Link and sap.ui.commons.TextField, sap.ui.commons.Checkbox, sap.m.Checkbox
autoResizable.description: Enables auto-resizing of the column on doubleclicking the resizer. Currently only implemented to work with the following controls: sap.m.Text, sap.m.Label, sap.m.Link , sap.m.Input, sap.ui.commons.TextView, sap.ui.commons.Label, sap.ui.commons.Link and sap.ui.commons.TextField, sap.ui.commons.Checkbox, sap.m.Checkbox

inResult.helpDescription: Specifies that the dimension referred to by the column shall be included in the granularity of the data result. It allows a finer distinction between a visible/grouped/(included)inResult column.
inResult.description: Specifies that the dimension referred to by the column shall be included in the granularity of the data result. It allows a finer distinction between a visible/grouped/(included)inResult column.

sortProperty.helpDescription: Specifies the binding property on which the column will sort.
sortProperty.description: Specifies the binding property on which the column will sort.

defaultFilterOperator.helpDescription:
If this property is set the default filter operator of the column is overwritten.
By default "Contains" is used for string and "EQ" for other types. A valid sap.ui.model.FilterOperator needs to be passed.
defaultFilterOperator.description:
If this property is set the default filter operator of the column is overwritten.
By default "Contains" is used for string and "EQ" for other types. A valid sap.ui.model.FilterOperator needs to be passed.

sorted.helpDescription: flag, if the column is sorted or not (displays the sorting indicator, does not trigger the sort method!)
sorted.description: flag, if the column is sorted or not (displays the sorting indicator, does not trigger the sort method!)

flexible.helpDescription: Is the width of the column flexible (grows on resize)?
flexible.description: Is the width of the column flexible (grows on resize)?

summed.helpDescription: If defined a sum for this column is calculated
summed.description: If defined a sum for this column is calculated

showSortMenuEntry.helpDescription: Define if the sort menu entries are displayed
showSortMenuEntry.description: Define if the sort menu entries are displayed

filterType.helpDescription: Type of Filter. This is used to transform the search term to the specified type, to make sure that the right columns are displayed. This should be the same as defined in binding for this column. As alternative you can pass a function which does the conversion. The function receives the entered filter value as parameter and returns the proper value for the filter expression. Another option is to pass the classname of the type, e.g.: sap.ui.model.type.Date or an expression similar to the binding syntax, e.g.: "\{type: 'sap.ui.model.type.Date', formatOptions: \{UTC: true\}, constraints: {} \}". Here the escaping is mandatory to avoid handling by the binding parser. By default the filter type is sap.ui.model.type.String.
filterType.description: Type of Filter. This is used to transform the search term to the specified type, to make sure that the right columns are displayed. This should be the same as defined in binding for this column. As alternative you can pass a function which does the conversion. The function receives the entered filter value as parameter and returns the proper value for the filter expression. Another option is to pass the classname of the type, e.g.: sap.ui.model.type.Date or an expression similar to the binding syntax, e.g.: "\{type: 'sap.ui.model.type.Date', formatOptions: \{UTC: true\}, constraints: {} \}". Here the escaping is mandatory to avoid handling by the binding parser. By default the filter type is sap.ui.model.type.String.

leadingProperty.helpDescription: Defines the primary model property which is used inside the Column. In case of the analytical extension this means the property which is grouped by for dimensions or the property which is summed for measures.
leadingProperty.description: Defines the primary model property which is used inside the Column. In case of the analytical extension this means the property which is grouped by for dimensions or the property which is summed for measures.

sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu.helpDescription: The column menu provides all common actions that can be performed on a column.
sap.ui.table.ColumnMenu.description: The column menu provides all common actions that can be performed on a column.

sap.ui.table.TablePersoController.helpDescription: The TablePersoController can be used to connect a table with a persistence service.
sap.ui.table.TablePersoController.description: The TablePersoController can be used to connect a table with a persistence service.

table.helpDescription: The target table of this controller.
table.description: The target table of this controller.

customDataKey.helpDescription: By defining a custom data key the TablePersoController will try to get the key for saving the perso data from the custom data of the Table and Column instead of creating it by concatenating the ID of the Table and the Column. Basically this will be more stable than using the auto IDs.
customDataKey.description: By defining a custom data key the TablePersoController will try to get the key for saving the perso data from the custom data of the Table and Column instead of creating it by concatenating the ID of the Table and the Column. Basically this will be more stable than using the auto IDs.

persoService.helpDescription:
Personalization Service object. Needs to have the following methods:
  • getPersData() : jQuery Promise (http://api.jquery.com/promise/)
  • setPersData(oBundle) : jQuery Promise (http://api.jquery.com/promise/)
  • delPersData() : jQuery Promise (http://api.jquery.com/promise/)
persoService.description:
Personalization Service object. Needs to have the following methods:
  • getPersData() : jQuery Promise (http://api.jquery.com/promise/)
  • setPersData(oBundle) : jQuery Promise (http://api.jquery.com/promise/)
  • delPersData() : jQuery Promise (http://api.jquery.com/promise/)

toggleOpenState.helpDescription: fired when a node has been expanded or collapsed (only available in hierachical mode)
toggleOpenState.description: fired when a node has been expanded or collapsed (only available in hierachical mode)
toggleOpenState.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

extension.helpDescription: Extension section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)
extension.description: Extension section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)

footer.helpDescription: Control or text of footer section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)
footer.description: Control or text of footer section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)

title.helpDescription: Control or text of title section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)
title.description: Control or text of title section of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)

toolbar.helpDescription: Toolbar of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)
toolbar.description: Toolbar of the Table (if not set it will be hidden)

noData.helpDescription: The value for the noData aggregation can be either a string value or a control instance. The control is shown, in case there is no data for the Table available. In case of a string value this will simply replace the no data text.
noData.description: The value for the noData aggregation can be either a string value or a control instance. The control is shown, in case there is no data for the Table available. In case of a string value this will simply replace the no data text.

visibleRowCountMode.helpDescription: This defines how the table handles the visible rows in the table. The default behavior is, that a fixed row count is defined. If you change it to auto the visibleRowCount property is changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its maximum row count to the space it is allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) and its minimum row count to the value of the property minAutoRowCount (default value : 5) In manual mode the user can change the visibleRowCount interactively.
visibleRowCountMode.description: This defines how the table handles the visible rows in the table. The default behavior is, that a fixed row count is defined. If you change it to auto the visibleRowCount property is changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its maximum row count to the space it is allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) and its minimum row count to the value of the property minAutoRowCount (default value : 5) In manual mode the user can change the visibleRowCount interactively.

expandFirstLevel.helpDescription: Flag to enable or disable expanding of first level.
expandFirstLevel.description: Flag to enable or disable expanding of first level.

enableGrouping.helpDescription: Flag to enable or disable column grouping. (experimental!)
enableGrouping.description: Flag to enable or disable column grouping. (experimental!)

enableBusyIndicator.helpDescription: Set this parameter to true to make the table handle the busy indicator by its own. The table will switch to busy as soon as it scrolls into an unpaged area.
enableBusyIndicator.description: Set this parameter to true to make the table handle the busy indicator by its own. The table will switch to busy as soon as it scrolls into an unpaged area.

groupHeaderProperty.helpDescription: The property name of the rows data which will be displayed as a group header if the group mode is enabled
groupHeaderProperty.description: The property name of the rows data which will be displayed as a group header if the group mode is enabled

showOverlay.helpDescription: Setting this property to true will show an overlay on top of the Table content and users cannot click anymore on the Table content.
showOverlay.description: Setting this property to true will show an overlay on top of the Table content and users cannot click anymore on the Table content.

enableSelectAll.helpDescription: Specifies if a select all button should be displayed in the top left corner.
enableSelectAll.description: Specifies if a select all button should be displayed in the top left corner.

columnHeaderVisible.helpDescription: Flag whether the column header is visible or not.
columnHeaderVisible.description: Flag whether the column header is visible or not.

enableCellFilter.helpDescription: Flag whether to enable or disable the context menu on cells to trigger a filtering with the cell value.
enableCellFilter.description: Flag whether to enable or disable the context menu on cells to trigger a filtering with the cell value.

columnHeaderHeight.helpDescription: Height of the column header of the Table in pixel.
columnHeaderHeight.description: Height of the column header of the Table in pixel.

enableColumnFreeze.helpDescription: Flag whether to show or hide the column menu item to freeze or unfreeze a column.
enableColumnFreeze.description: Flag whether to show or hide the column menu item to freeze or unfreeze a column.

selectedIndex.helpDescription: Zero-based index of selected item. Index value for no selection is -1. When multi-selection is enabled and multiple items are selected, the method returns the lead selected item. Sets the zero-based index of the currently selected item. This method removes any previous selections. When the given index is invalid, the call is ignored.
selectedIndex.description: Zero-based index of selected item. Index value for no selection is -1. When multi-selection is enabled and multiple items are selected, the method returns the lead selected item. Sets the zero-based index of the currently selected item. This method removes any previous selections. When the given index is invalid, the call is ignored.

noDataText.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22.1 The aggregation noData also supports string values now. Use noData instead.
This text is shown, in case there is no data available to be displayed in the Table and no custom noData control is set.
noDataText.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.22.1 The aggregation noData also supports string values now. Use noData instead.
This text is shown, in case there is no data available to be displayed in the Table and no custom noData control is set.

minAutoRowCount.helpDescription: This property is used to set the minimum count of visible rows when the property visibleRowCountMode is set to Auto. For any other visibleRowCountMode, it is ignored.
minAutoRowCount.description: This property is used to set the minimum count of visible rows when the property visibleRowCountMode is set to Auto. For any other visibleRowCountMode, it is ignored.

showNoData.helpDescription: Flag whether to show the no data overlay or not once the table is empty.
showNoData.description: Flag whether to show the no data overlay or not once the table is empty.

collapseRecursive.helpDescription:
Setting collapseRecursive to true means, that when collapsing a node all subsequent child nodes will also be collapsed.
This property is only supported with sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel
collapseRecursive.description:
Setting collapseRecursive to true means, that when collapsing a node all subsequent child nodes will also be collapsed.
This property is only supported with sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel

visibleRowCount.helpDescription: Count of visible rows (will overwrite the height property).
visibleRowCount.description: Count of visible rows (will overwrite the height property).

fixedBottomRowCount.helpDescription: Number of rows that are fix on the bottom. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll. (experimental!)
fixedBottomRowCount.description: Number of rows that are fix on the bottom. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll. (experimental!)

navigationMode.helpDescription: Flag whether to use the scroll mode or paging mode. If the Paginator mode is used it will require the sap.ui.commons library!
navigationMode.description: Flag whether to use the scroll mode or paging mode. If the Paginator mode is used it will require the sap.ui.commons library!

allowColumnReordering.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.5.2 Use the property enableColumnReordering instead.
Flag to enable or disable column reordering
allowColumnReordering.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.5.2 Use the property enableColumnReordering instead.
Flag to enable or disable column reordering

rowHeight.helpDescription: Height of a row of the Table in pixel.
rowHeight.description: Height of a row of the Table in pixel.

editable.helpDescription: Flag whether the controls of the Table are editable or not (currently this only controls the background color!)
editable.description: Flag whether the controls of the Table are editable or not (currently this only controls the background color!)

showColumnVisibilityMenu.helpDescription: Flag to show or hide the column visibility menu.
showColumnVisibilityMenu.description: Flag to show or hide the column visibility menu.

threshold.helpDescription: Threshold to fetch the next chunk of data. The minimal threshold can be the visible row count of the Table. If the value is 0 then the thresholding is disabled.
threshold.description: Threshold to fetch the next chunk of data. The minimal threshold can be the visible row count of the Table. If the value is 0 then the thresholding is disabled.

enableColumnReordering.helpDescription: Flag to enable or disable column reordering
enableColumnReordering.description: Flag to enable or disable column reordering

rootLevel.helpDescription:
The root level is the level of the topmost tree nodes, which will be used as an entry point for OData services.
This property is only supported when the TreeTable uses an underlying odata services with hierarchy annotations.
This property is only supported with sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel
The hierarchy annotations may also be provided locally as a parameter for the ODataTreeBinding.
rootLevel.description:
The root level is the level of the topmost tree nodes, which will be used as an entry point for OData services.
This property is only supported when the TreeTable uses an underlying odata services with hierarchy annotations.
This property is only supported with sap.ui.model.odata.v2.ODataModel
The hierarchy annotations may also be provided locally as a parameter for the ODataTreeBinding.

enableCustomFilter.helpDescription: Set this parameter to true to implement your own filter behaviour. Instead of the filter input box a button will be rendered for which' press event (customFilter) you can register an event handler.
enableCustomFilter.description: Set this parameter to true to implement your own filter behaviour. Instead of the filter input box a button will be rendered for which' press event (customFilter) you can register an event handler.

useGroupMode.helpDescription:
If group mode is enable nodes with subitems are rendered as if they were group headers.
This can be used to do the grouping for an OData service on the backend and visualize this in a table.
This mode only makes sense if the tree has a depth of exacly 1 (group headers and entries)
useGroupMode.description:
If group mode is enable nodes with subitems are rendered as if they were group headers.
This can be used to do the grouping for an OData service on the backend and visualize this in a table.
This mode only makes sense if the tree has a depth of exacly 1 (group headers and entries)

fixedColumnCount.helpDescription: Number of columns that are fix on the left. When you use a horizontal scroll bar, only the columns which are not fixed, will scroll. Fixed columns need a defined width for the feature to work.
fixedColumnCount.description: Number of columns that are fix on the left. When you use a horizontal scroll bar, only the columns which are not fixed, will scroll. Fixed columns need a defined width for the feature to work.

fixedRowCount.helpDescription: Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll.
fixedRowCount.description: Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll.

sap.ui.table.Table.helpDescription:
Provides a comprehensive set of features for displaying and dealing with vast amounts of data. The Table control supports desktop PCs and tablet devices. On tablets, special consideration should be given to the number of visible columns and rows due to the limited performance of some devices.

In order to keep the document DOM as lean as possible, the Table control reuses its DOM elements of the rows. When the user scrolls, only the row contexts are changed but the rendered controls remain the same. This allows the Table control to handle huge amounts of data. Nevertheless, restrictions apply regarding the number of displayed columns. Keep the number as low as possible to improve performance. Due to the nature of tables, the used control for column templates also has a big influence on the performance.

The Table control relies completely on data binding, and its supported feature set is tightly coupled to the data model and binding being used.

sort.description: fired when the table is sorted.
sort.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

customFilter.description: fired when the table is sorted.
customFilter.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

columnSelect.helpDescription: fired when the table is sorted.
columnSelect.description: fired when the table is sorted.
columnSelect.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

rowSelectionChange.helpDescription: fired when the table is sorted.
rowSelectionChange.description: fired when the table is sorted.
rowSelectionChange.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

This method removes any previous selections. When the given index is invalid, the call is ignored.
selectedIndex.description: Zero-based index of selected item. Index value for no selection is -1. When multi-selection is enabled and multiple items are selected, the method returns the lead selected item. Sets the zero-based index of the currently selected item. This method removes any previous selections. When the given index is invalid, the call is ignored.

noDataText.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22.1 The aggregation noData also supports string values now. Use noData instead.
This text is shown, in case there is no data available to be displayed in the Table and no custom noData control is set.
noDataText.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.22.1 The aggregation noData also supports string values now. Use noData instead.
This text is shown, in case there is no data available to be displayed in the Table and no custom noData control is set.

minAutoRowCount.helpDescription: This property is used to set the minimum count of visible rows when the property visibleRowCountMode is set to Auto. For any other visibleRowCountMode, it is ignored.
minAutoRowCount.description: This property is used to set the minimum count of visible rows when the property visibleRowCountMode is set to Auto. For any other visibleRowCountMode, it is ignored.

showNoData.helpDescription: Flag whether to show the no data overlay or not once the table is empty.
showNoData.description: Flag whether to show the no data overlay or not once the table is empty.

visibleRowCount.helpDescription: Count of visible rows (will overwrite the height property).
visibleRowCount.description: Count of visible rows (will overwrite the height property).

fixedBottomRowCount.helpDescription: Number of rows that are fix on the bottom. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll. (experimental!)
fixedBottomRowCount.description: Number of rows that are fix on the bottom. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll. (experimental!)

navigationMode.helpDescription: Flag whether to use the scroll mode or paging mode. If the Paginator mode is used it will require the sap.ui.commons library!
navigationMode.description: Flag whether to use the scroll mode or paging mode. If the Paginator mode is used it will require the sap.ui.commons library!

allowColumnReordering.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.5.2 Use the property enableColumnReordering instead.
Flag to enable or disable column reordering
allowColumnReordering.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.5.2 Use the property enableColumnReordering instead.
Flag to enable or disable column reordering

rowHeight.helpDescription: Height of a row of the Table in pixel.
rowHeight.description: Height of a row of the Table in pixel.

editable.helpDescription: Flag whether the controls of the Table are editable or not (currently this only controls the background color!)
editable.description: Flag whether the controls of the Table are editable or not (currently this only controls the background color!)

showColumnVisibilityMenu.helpDescription: Flag to show or hide the column visibility menu.
showColumnVisibilityMenu.description: Flag to show or hide the column visibility menu.

threshold.helpDescription: Threshold to fetch the next chunk of data. The minimal threshold can be the visible row count of the Table. If the value is 0 then the thresholding is disabled.
threshold.description: Threshold to fetch the next chunk of data. The minimal threshold can be the visible row count of the Table. If the value is 0 then the thresholding is disabled.

enableColumnReordering.helpDescription: Flag to enable or disable column reordering
enableColumnReordering.description: Flag to enable or disable column reordering

enableCustomFilter.helpDescription: Set this parameter to true to implement your own filter behaviour. Instead of the filter input box a button will be rendered for which' press event (customFilter) you can register an event handler.
enableCustomFilter.description: Set this parameter to true to implement your own filter behaviour. Instead of the filter input box a button will be rendered for which' press event (customFilter) you can register an event handler.

fixedColumnCount.helpDescription: Number of columns that are fix on the left. When you use a horizontal scroll bar, only the columns which are not fixed, will scroll. Fixed columns need a defined width for the feature to work.
fixedColumnCount.description: Number of columns that are fix on the left. When you use a horizontal scroll bar, only the columns which are not fixed, will scroll. Fixed columns need a defined width for the feature to work.

fixedRowCount.helpDescription: Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll.
fixedRowCount.description: Number of rows that are fix on the top. When you use a vertical scroll bar, only the rows which are not fixed, will scroll.
